snippet: The Republican presidential candidate’s comments drew condemnation from Europe and beyond, as well as questions about the direction of the United States.
abstract: Donald J Trump's call for ban on entry of Muslims into United States draws widespread condemnation around globe, as well as despair and confusion; Trump's ideas have also drawn some support from anti-immigrant movements in Europe and China, where they are reflected in growing nationalist sentiment; thoughts expressed by Trump have raised questions over future of America, Arab region and ideals of inclusion throughout world.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Elian Peltier and Lilia Blaise from Paris; Hannah Olivennes from London; Elisabetta Povoledo from Rome; Ben Hubbard from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Carlotta Gall from Algiers; Jane Perlez and Yufan Huang from Beijing; Kareem Fahim from Cairo; and Amina Ismail from Ismailia, Egypt.
